rose.info: Used for skin care and in cosmetics.

tulsi.info: Used in Ayurveda for its medicinal properties.

aloevera.info: Known for its soothing and healing properties.

lavender.info: Used in aromatherapy for relaxation and sleep improvement.

mint.info: Commonly used to aid digestion and relieve headaches.

chamomile.info: Used to promote relaxation and help with sleep.

dandelion.info: Used as a diuretic and to aid digestion.

ginger.info: Known for its anti-nausea and anti-inflammatory properties.

turmeric.info: Contains curcumin, which has anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.

basil.info: Used in cooking and has antibacterial properties.

parsley.info: Rich in vitamins and used for its diuretic properties.

thyme.info: Has antimicrobial properties and is used in cooking and medicine.

rosemary.info: Used to improve memory and concentration, and for its antioxidant properties.

sage.info: Known for its digestive benefits and antimicrobial properties.

oregano.info: Contains antioxidants and is used for its anti-inflammatory effects.

coriander.info: Used for its antioxidant and digestive benefits.

fennel.info: Known for its digestive benefits and ability to reduce bloating.

jasmine.info: Used in aromatherapy for its calming effects and to reduce stress.

hibiscus.info: Rich in antioxidants and used to lower blood pressure.

echinacea.info: Boosts the immune system and is used to prevent colds.
